title: EDF Energy to pay £6m to Ofgem after breaching market regulations
lead: The energy firm admitted: ‘EDF ETG takes this issue extremely seriously and apologises for the error’

title: Drax reaches agreement to sell gas assets for £193m
lead: The British power producer plans to use the proceeds from the sale to develop its biomass business

title: Covid-19 restrictions ‘likely to have caused 7% fall in smart meter installations last month’
lead: All UK regions indicated similar decreases in installations when compared with October’s figures, according to a report

title: Vestas closes agreement for MHI’s stake in offshore joint venture
lead: The Danish wind turbine manufacturer will acquire Mitsubishi Heavy Industries’ share in return for a 2.5% stake in the company

title: Danish Energy Agency greenlights Vattenfall’s 350MW offshore wind plans
lead: The two new offshore wind farms are forecast to increase Danish electricity production from wind turbines by around 10%

title: ‘UK’s first’ long-distance battery-hybrid trains to run on London-Penzance route
lead: Existing intercity trains will be fitted with battery technology on a project, the testing of which is expected to begin in 2022

title: Not a baaa-d idea… trial launches to test impact of sheep grazing on solar farm
lead: The project aims to investigate the impact of sheep around solar panels and the benefits of dual-use of land

title: Australia announces immediate support for refineries to tackle Covid-19 shocks
lead: The government will bring forward production payments to support the country’s oil refineries

title: It’s Triad season: What you need to know 2020/21
lead: Triads incentivise heavy commercial and industrial users of electricity to shift their power use to periods of lower demand, by charging a premium for high consumption at certain times.

title: US startup unveils solar-powered EV that ‘needs no charging’ for most daily use
lead: The vehicle integrates a solar system, which offers it a range of 45 miles per day
